Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2009 09:49AM butterfly137 wrote: WOW....just watched GMA on you tube, and I am in tears at my office!  Sweet Pea...you are AMAZING!  You are so right, this is NOT punishment from God, and He specifically chose you, me and all of us, because he trusted us with the strength to pull through.  I Love the elephant hugs, but since I have a little sister your age, so, I'm gonna say Big Sister Elephant Hugs to you and your family! Much Love To ALL
Posts.Title: HELP! 10 year old with bc cjsocal Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2009 01:39PM butterfly137 wrote: Nope, no news yet.  Each day I seem to be growing less and less "stable" mentally...hahahha which I am already a Gemini....sooooo...syke j/k hope no other Gemini's took offense, but if you are you know how crazy we can already be!  At any rate...I am trying to plan a beach getaway for my birthday which is not this Friday, but next...I just want to stand in the water and look out in the middle of the night with the moons reflection...and listen to the waves.....*sighing* I can almost smell the ocean now...well, at any rate, i will keep you all posted.  I LOVE hearing from people, I really get alot out of YOUR stories, so please feel free to message me!
Posts.Title: 23 and waiting... butterfly137 butterfly137

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2009 09:24AM - edited Jun 3, 2009 09:26AM by butterfly137 The results are in, BUT get this.  I had to call the hospital, go and sign for the medical records, and read them myself.  I am already in the works of having my doctors office in some serious trouble, because I am furious with this.  Here I am 23, on the verge of having a mental breakdown and the doctor at the hospital signed off on the results the SAME f*ing day!  Yet I have been waiting in limbo...SO...I went to the hospital, almost couldn't go in I was so scared, and then they just handed me an envelope...which I took to a local beach opened the Bible and prayed first.  It took me about an hour to open it.  ANYWAY...from what I can understand I do have a 1cm lesion that he could not determine if it was "arising from the clavicle or one of the anterior upper ribs"  Therefore further, and immediate, testing was recommended!  There is also a comment about one of my lymph nodes...which I have no idea what it means, so any help would be nice...but it says "Incidental note is made of a right axillary lymph node measuring 13x7 mm in size, showing normal nodal architechture."  So does that mean I just have a bigger lymph node than normal, OR does it mean THAT is an area of concern too?  I am glad to have SOME type of results, but so FUMING mad right now.  I could barely focus driving yesterday, or today for that matter, and I don't want to be at work....I just want to go home, pack up, and start driving to FL and live in my car!  No lie.  I am so frustrated and feeling lonely, and like I wasn't important enough to call.  evoashes:  Hang in there...make sure you stay on top of your doctor, and if they aren't responding you CAN go get your own results.  I would definately recommend bringing a friend tho, I did it alone, and almost couldn't go in.  Much Love To All!
Posts.Title: 23 and waiting... butterfly137 butterfly137

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2009 03:46PM butterfly137 wrote: I read this thread today, and was wondering if you had the results.  I played the waiting game for almost two months just to find out everything was negative.  And although I am not a mother, or even a wife, so I cannot imagine half of your plights, I was still very scared/anxious/angry...and many other feelings.  I will have you in my prayers formykids...I really will.  Much Love To All!!!
Posts.Title: Feeling like I am going to totally lose it!! formykids concernedsis

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2009 09:12PM butterfly137 wrote: Hahahaha jacee, that cracked me up! And for everyone else, the wait is the hardest thing I have had to endure yet...YET is the key word, but I really can't imagine it being worse than the waiting...please tell me now, am I in for way more than I realize?????
Posts.Title: If cancer, do they call me??? jjjmjoh I_am_4_GOD

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2009 12:08PM butterfly137 wrote: Cathy, Wow...even more confusion.  Well, YOU are your best researcher.  That is one thing I found out.  I literally had to go and get my results from medical records because my doctors office wouldn't call me back.  That's a long story, and then I couldn't read half the words.  At that time, this was the first lump, and the results basically said there was a mass that needed more testing, so here i was 23, I just turned 24, and I was just by myself, and scared to death.  All I could do was go home, and snuggle with my dog.  But, then we I pulled myself together, the women on here helped out and were right there for me.  Hang in there....keep me posted!  Much Love To All!!!

Posts.Content: May 29, 2009 11:19AM butterfly137 wrote: Thank you all SO very much.  Today my mother got me a shirt that has the ribbon on it, and says "fight like a girl"...so you were all so right, and she has known my fears all along.  I am still waiting to hear from the doctor, but I cannot thank you enough for all of your love and support!  Thank you!
Posts.Title: 23 and waiting... butterfly137 butterfly137

Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2009 03:23PM - edited Jun 2, 2009 03:40PM by butterfly137 Ocean City would work!  Any of the beaches...I'm about an hour or a little more away from all of them...  So...crossing the fingers and hoping I can go...  Today started out PRETTY rough, but I am in such high spirits right now, it's amazing!  Lots of good stuff on here today =)  much love to all of you!  Oh yea...I heard an awesome saying..."Remember, if you are going to fight the monster, make sure YOU don't turn into the monster"  We have each other to turn to, this disease may take away body parts, and even lives, but together we can fight it and Praise God, eventually find a CURE!
